member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with an Android device via the (A)ndroid (D)ebug (B)ridge.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.
*NOTE* All functions in this and some sub-classes are designed to work primary without root.
*NOTE* If u want to use all functions with root rights, u have to restart the ADB Deamon on the device with root rights. Also u need to set UseSu to IDSu.AUTO or IDSu.ENFORCE.
*NOTE* U can do so by using Instance().Device.Deamon.Root() or simply Instance().Root().

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Instance(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns and if not exists creates, the choosen ADB device instance
*NOTE* This is the basic interactor in this class, via this var u MUST get/create every device instance.
*NOTE* Via device u can get/create the device specific instance. If device is empty, the return is ever the class selected device.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Instance(AndroidCtrl.DataModelDevicesItem)
member.summary:
Returns and if not exists creates, the choosen ADB device instance
*NOTE* This is the basic interactor in this class, via this var u MUST get/create every device instance.
*NOTE* Via device u can get/create the device specific instance. If device is null, the return is ever the class selected device.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.UseBusyBox
member.summary:
UseBusyBox de-/activate BusyBox for the whole instance. Set false for unset.
*NOTE* If no BusyBox is installed on the device, this parameter can't be set to true it will always return false!

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.UseSu
member.summary:
UseSu manage the su use for shell requests.
*NOTE* If su is not installed on the device, this parameter can't be changed and will always return IDSu.NEVER!
*NOTE* This property will not affect the ADB base class, but all subclasses that interact with the shell! Except these which needs root to interact with the device.
*NOTE* If adbd runs in root mode or su is found, while creating the ADB device instance, the default value will be IDSu.AUTO

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Install(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Install an APK on the Device
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
*HINT* -d allow version downgrade
*HINT* -g grant all runtime permissions
*HINT* -l forward-lock the app
*HINT* -r reinstall the app and keep its data
*HINT* -s install the app on SD-Card instead of the internal storage
*HINT* -t allow test package
*HINT* the rest of the params u can use, u can find in the adb help
member.param: time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Install(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Install-Multiple APK's on the Device
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
*HINT* -d allow version downgrade
*HINT* -g grant all runtime permissions
*HINT* -l forward-lock the app
*HINT* -r reinstall the app and keep its data
*HINT* -p partial application install
*HINT* -s install the app on SD-Card instead of the internal storage
*HINT* -t allow test package
*HINT* the rest of the params u can use, u can find in the adb help
member.param: time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout

*NOTE* This class require root access!

Cancel the current operation

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromLine(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Creates an Key-Array from the given data

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromLine(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Creates an Key-Array from the given data

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.String[])
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given query data
*NOTE* This query is auto-terminated with an ";"
*NOTE* U can send an single string query like "SELECT * FROM somewhere"
*NOTE* Or u can build an query like ("SELECT", "*", "FROM", "somewhere")
*WARNING* Use "X'0D'" and "X'0A'" instead of "\r" and "\n" in ur requests! If u can't avoid an request with "\r" or "\n", use Execute() and parse the output ur self.
*HINT* U can use QueryTools.ReplaceNL() to replace "\r" and "\n"

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given output
*NOTE* "rawData" must be created with ".header ON" output (Options.Header = true) otherwise this method will fail!
*IMPORTENT* The 1st line in the List<string> must be the table headers!
member.param: For example the return from ExecuteQuery()

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.Execute(System.String)
member.summary:
Execute ur own sqlite3 command
*NOTE* Remember if u send an SQL-query terminate it with an ";" or simply use Query()

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.ExecuteQuery(System.String[])
member.summary:
Send the given SQL-query to the device
*NOTE* This query is auto-terminated with an ";"
*NOTE* U can send an single string query like "SELECT * FROM somewhere"
*NOTE* Or u can build an query like ("SELECT", "*", "FROM", "somewhere")
*WARNING* Use "X'0D'" and "X'0A'" instead of "\r" and "\n" in ur requests! If u can't avoid an request with "\r" or "\n", use Execute() and parse the output ur self.
*HINT* U can use QueryTools.ReplaceNL() to replace "\r" and "\n"
*REASON* This function will cut the 1st line of output to guarantee that u only get the requested output, without the query-command u send.
*REASON* In addition, this feature is really relevant for internal needs.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the remote DB for interaction

This class is designed to define the needed sqlite3 options

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite3.options.Mode
member.summary:
.mode (Set output mode where Mode is one of:)
csv (Comma-separated values)
column (Left-aligned columns. (See .width))
html (HTML code)
insert (SQL insert statements for TABLE)
line (One value per line)
list (Values delimited by .separator string)
tabs (Tab-separated values)
tcl (TCL list elements)

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SuShellRT
member.summary:
SuShellRT starts an ADB shell process with su rights in an background thread and return its output via its CallbackProcessOutput delegate, u have also the ablility to send commands to the running shell via RunCMD("my command") function.
*NOTE* Between the cmds is an delay of 150 ms
*NOTE* This class require root access!

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Directories.Chmod(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the given chmod for this directory on the device.
*NOTE* U can also set an unix chmod (rwxrwxrwx). If u want to set an unix format u must use the full 9 chars.
*NOTE* Like this examples: (rw-rwx-wt), (rwsrwsrwt), (rw-r--r--)
*HINT* Usefull if u use the directory parser and want to copy some permissions to other files/folders.
*HINT* This function uses Tools.General.ConvertUnixChmod() to convert the unix format to an number.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.PushPullUTF8
member.summary:
PushPullUTF8 is an ADB push/pull UTF-8 wrapper.
U've never seen this before, with this extreme powerfull wrapper class, u can transfer UTF-8 encoded file/folder names to/from ur device
with the correct names after the copy process. So u'll never again have problems with files/folders names/paths which contains for example ( etc.).

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Fastboot.HTC_Fastboot
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with an Android device via Fastboot.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.Fastboot.HTC_Fastboot.Instance(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns and if not exist creates, the choosen Fastboot device instance
*NOTE* This is the basic interactor in this class, via this var u MUST get/create every device instance.
*NOTE* Via device u can get/create the device specific instance. If device is empty, the return is ever the class selected device.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General
member.summary: Give u a few pre-defined .NET process models

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General.ExecuteBG(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,AndroidCtrl.CallbackProcessResponse)
member.summary:
Executes a single command in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite.
Defines the callback to raise for any output/error response during the operation.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General.ExecuteBGStack(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,AndroidCtrl.CallbackProcessResponse)
member.summary:
Executes a stack of commands in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* Directly after launching the executable there will be send two blank lines to the process. This happens to activate an inactive shell instance for example.
*NOTE* Between the cmds in the stack is an min. delay of 500 ms
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite.
Defines the callback to raise for any output/error response during the operation.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General.ExecuteBGStackADB(AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,AndroidCtrl.CallbackProcessResponse)
member.summary:
Executes a stack of ADB commands in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* This is only usefull if u want to send a stack of shell/emu commands.
*NOTE* If u want to send different ADB commands u need to use ExecuteBGStack() like, ExecuteBGStack("cmd.exe", "", ADBCommandStack, timeout)
*NOTE* Between the cmds in the stack is an delay of 500 ms
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite and timeOut = 0 implies the use of the class internal CmdTimeOut.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite and 0 implies the use of the class internal CmdTimeOut.
Defines the callback to raise for any output/error response during the operation.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Signer.Signer
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with the Signapk.jar.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.
*NOTE* Until JavaExists returns false, all calls inside this class and all subclasses will not work!
*NOTE* If u call any method until JavaExists returns false, u'll get no exceptions! Coz, ExecuteBG() checks if the given
*NOTE* (.exe) file exists, if not, it will return an empty List string. So if the (.exe) not exists no call will be executed!
